derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: modern Latin, from Greek gastroknēmia 'calf of the leg', from gaster, gastr- 'stomach' + knēmē 'leg' (from the bulging shape of the calf)

means.word_mean: 1. the muscle in the back part of the leg that forms the greater part of the calf; responsible for the plantar flexion of the foot
